intro: Pleuranthodes orbiculare, commonly known as the broad-leaved pleuranthodes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its round, waxy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
